msDesc.head: Konrad von Soltau on the Sentences; canon law; papal formularies. Germany, presumably Erfurt, early 15th century.

msItem.note: On the upper pastedown is a fifteenth-century table of contents, including as the first item, now missing, 'Priuilegia studii Erfordensis'

msItem.author: Konrad von Soltau
msItem.title: Quaestiones on Peter Lombard's Sentences
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt questiones sententiarum magistri Conradum Soltonis sacre pagine professoris Studii Pragen.
msItem.incipit: Queritur circa primum sententiarum utrum per studium sacre scripture acquiratur habitus alius a fide
msItem.explicit: usque ad diem iudicij vident gloriam sanctorum. Quam nobis concedat qui sine fine viuit et regnat in secula seculorum amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt questiones sententiarum magistri Conradi Sultonis etc.

msItem.note: Fol. 163v originally blank; added in a different hand:
Confirmation by John XXII of an indulgence of 30 days granted by Urban IV.
Notes from Augustine and Bernard of Clairvaux on the twelve abuses.
Verses attributed to Bernard: 'Monachus velox ad mensam ... Monachum demonicum conuersum perversum'; WIC 11178, cf. Speculum peccatoris (PL 40.991).
Fol. 164r-v blank.

msItem.author: Giovanni Calderini
msItem.title: De interdicto ecclesiastico
msItem.rubric: Tractatus de ecclesiastico interdicto Johannis Calderini
msItem.incipit: Quamvis dubia plurima iuxta materiam interdicti
msItem.explicit: concessa ipsi ecclesie a christo cui est honor et gloria per infinita
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit interdictum ecclesiasticum Johannis Calderini Bononiensis

msItem.title: Index
msItem.rubric: Hoc est registrum ecclesiastici interdicti Johannis Calderini
msItem.incipit: In hoc tractatu tractatur primo de dispositione interdicti ecclesiastici cum declaracione membrorum. Secundo de speciebus interdicti.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Registrum ecclesiastici interdicti Johannis Kalderini
msItem.note: Fol. 191vb blank.

msItem.author: Arnoldus de Augusta
msItem.title: Arengae
msItem.incipit: Reuerendoissimo in christo patri ac domino suo thome sancte salzenburgensis ecclesie archiepiscopo
msItem.rubric: (fol. 193ra) Incipiunt arenge iudiciales. Hic inchoatur prima particula in qua sunt arenge de invocacione nominis Christi et trium personarum in diuinis. Primo perswadet deum invocandum propter sufficienciam sapientie instruccionemiustitie et multiformis etc.
msItem.incipit: (fol. 193ra) Svfficentia nostra ex deo est ii ad Cor. iij. Scribitur in canone qui hec est gratie iterate sine saluatore uult habere salutem
msItem.explicit: tam copiosum quod neque finire tam preciosum quod non potest estimari.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt arenge magistri arnoldi de augusta canonum professoris canonici sancti mauricii augustinensis AMEN. Non reputes hoc modicum.
msItem.note: Fol. 245rb blank. Comparison with other manuscripts (e.g. Munich, BSB Clm 14280, fol. 3) suggests that the words 'hec est gratie iterate' in the incipit are a garbled version of the final words of the original rubric, 'gratie sapientie increate'.

msItem.rubric: Incipiunt tituli legum et primo Institutorum amen
msItem.incipit:
De adopcionibus
De auctoritate tutorum
De adepcione legatorum et translatione
msItem.explicit:
Vt differentes iudices audire interpellantium allegationes compellantur
De vsuris nauticis
msItem.note: The rubrics of the Institutes, Digest, Codex, Authenticum, arranged in alphabetical order, as printed (in different order) in the Modus legendi abbreviaturas (GW M24956; ISTC im00746000, etc.) but here without book or other numbers.
Followed by a note on usury:
msItem.incipit: Nota quinque sunt casus in quibus licet plus recipere pecunia mutuata

msItem.note: Diagrammatic notes on the canon law of marriage, frequently referring to Gratian, Decretum.

title.supplied: De modo procedendi in curia Romana

msItem.note: An anonymous and unidentified collection of texts on procedure in the papal courts: it is unclear to what extent it represents a single compilation and, sometimes, where the different sections end and begin.

title.supplied: De terminis causarum in curia Romana

msItem.incipit: Ordo terminorum in prima instancia. Primo post presentacionem commissionis citetur pars ad dicendum
Item si procedatur coram domino auditore tuo per audientiam contradictarum
msItem.explicit: (De interrogationis specialibus) audita et narrata huiusmodi in presenti causa deponeret etc.
msItem.note: Material in fols. 253va-257vb is closely paralleled (not always in the same order) in Freiburg im Breisgau, UB, Hs. 1154, fols. 31v-35v; for fols. 253va, 254va ('Qualiter procedatur in causis in palacio apostolico') see also BAV, Pal. lat. 685 fols. 35va-36r, 37vb-39v (pr. C. Lefebvre in Revue de droit canonique 10–11 (1960–1) 174–191); perhaps cf. also Eichstätt, UB, Cod. st. 618 fols. 164v-168ra.

msItem.rubric: De exceptionibus contra litteras et sigilla
msItem.incipit: Excipitur contra litteras et sigillia modis multis

msItem.rubric: Notabilia quedam circa iudicia superius non expressa
msItem.incipit: Si actor aut reus petat per auditorem conpelli adversarium
msItem.note: Cf. G. Ehler, Der Liber Cancellariae Apostolicae vom Jahre 1380 (1888), 226–8 (Dietrich von Nieheim, Stilus palatii abbreviatus)

msItem.incipit: Si lite pendente per alteram parcium aliquid in partibus
msItem.note: Cf. G. Erler, Der Liber Cancellariae (1888), 231–4 (Dietrich von Nieheim).

msItem.incipit: Ad cognoscendum publicum instrumentum octo requiruntur scilicet annus domini Indicio

msItem.title: Short formulary
msItem.incipit: Nos igitur talis auditor etc. Visis et diligenter inspectis
Nota quod si pars post conclusionem iura producere velit
msItem.note: Cf. G. Erler, Der Liber Cancellariae Apostolicae (1888), 224–5 (Dietrich von Nieheim).

msItem.incipit: De conclusionibus faciendis. Si decernatur remissio ad partes tunc post decretum
msItem.note: Cf. G. Erler, Der Liber Cancellariae Apostolicae (1888), 224–5 (Dietrich von Nieheim).

msItem.title: Novae constitutiones audientiae contradictarum in curia romana promulgatae A.D. 1375
msItem.incipit: In primis statuimus quod anno quolibet prima die mensis Octobris
msItem.explicit: allis illicite et inviolabiliter obseruentur etc. Finis.
msItem.bibl: Ed. J. Foerstemann (Leipzig, 1897), here without the prologue.

msItem.rubric: Obseruancie audientie causarum sacri pallacii apostolici
msItem.incipit: Primo nullus auditor iuxta constitutiones
Statuimus et ordinamus quod singuli et omnes procuratores in officio penitentiarie

msItem.note: Below, fols. 282ra-285vb

msItem.author: John XXII
msItem.title: Constitution 'Qui exacti'
msItem.rubric: Die xvj mensis Januarii Anno a natiuitate domini Mº cccº lxxvº fuerunt publicate presentes constitutiones de verbo ad verbum per dominum martinum de Thasters lectorem audien.
msItem.incipit: Johannes episcopus Que exacti temporis gesta recenset
msItem.explicit: absolutionis beneficium obtinere. Nulli ergo etc. Datum
msItem.note: Erler, Liber cancellariae, 191–6

msItem.title: Manual of the papal penitentiary
msItem.rubric: Incipit formularius sacre penitentiarie Romane curie. Primo copia Bulle constitucioni officii penitentiarie
msItem.note: C. H. Haskins, 'The sources for the history of the papal penitentiary', The American Journal of Theology Vol. 9, No. 3 (1905), 421–450, at 426–7, here the first two items only, pr. H. Denifle, 'Die Aelteste Taxrolle der apost. Pönitentiarie, Archiv für Litt. und Kirchengeschichte, 4, 1888.

msItem.author: Bernard Silvestris
msItem.title: Epistola rei familiaris
msItem.rubric: Epistola beati Bernardi de cura domestica vtilius gubernanda et regimine domus
msItem.incipit: Gratioso et felici militi
msItem.note: Followed, filling out the rest of fol. 286vb, by proverbial extracts, the first heading 'Verba salomonis' ('Quid prodest homini generacio clara ... de claro contemptibilem'), the second beginning 'humilitas dat ascensum' and ending 'deum si non timueris omnia timebis'.

msItem.author: Wilhelm Horborch
msItem.title: Decisiones nouae rotae Romanae
msItem.note: (abbreviation)
msItem.incipit: In nomine domini amen anno domini Mºcccºlxxviº die mercurii
De attemptatis. Primo quod attemptata appellatione pendente a diffinitiua
msItem.note: Highly abbreviated; ending at c. 75 in the edition of 1472 (GW 8200, chapter begins 'Item si petatur absolucio simpliciter...').
Rest of fol. 295r blank.

msItem.author: Boniface IX
msItem.title: Regulae cancellariae (Constitutio 'Intenta salutis', 1402)
msItem.incipit: Bonifacius episopus serus seruorum ... Intenta salutis operibus
msItem.explicit: roboris uel momenti. Nulli ergo Si quis autem Datum Rome apud sanctum Petrum xj kl. Januar. pontificatus nostri anno quartodecimo. Amen.
msItem.bibl: Regulae cancellariae apostolicae, ed. Emil von Ottenthal (Innsbruck, 1888), pp. 73–79 (cc. 67–81).
msItem.note: Rest of fol. 298v blank.

msItem.title: Regulae cancellariae Apostolicae, John XXII-Boniface IX
msItem.rubric: Regule date in vicecancellaria per dominum Johannem papam xxij
msItem.incipit: Infra scripte sunt regule restrictiue
msItem.bibl: Regulae cancellariae apostolicae, ed. Emil von Ottenthal (Innsbruck, 1888), pp. 1–70 (ending at c. 59).

msItem.note: Ordinances of John XXIII (1410?) for letters of gratia expectativa.
msItem.incipit: Prima videlicet viij kln. Junii sit pro familiaribus commensalibus domini nostri pape. Secunda data videlicet vij kln. Junij
msItem.note: Printed in The Register of Nicholas Bubwith, ed. T. S. Holmes, II, Somerset Record Society 30 (1914), 581–3 with the heading 'sequitur date que ponentur in graciis expectativis per modum qui sequitur'
Added, fifteenth century.

physDesc.p: Apparently two codicological units (fols. 1–164, 165–323, the second falling into two sections, fols. 165–286, 287–323), with the same scribe chiefly responsible for both units, which were evidently together early or from the outset.

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Watermarks: (fols. 1–164 except quires 7, 8, 13), bull's head with 6-pointed star; (quires 7, 8, 13) bull's head with 5-petalled flower, resembles WZIS DE4620-PO-65005 (1410); (fols. 165–78) fleur-de-lis with 6-petalled flower; (fols. 189–323) fleur-de-lis with 8-pointed star.
supportDesc.extent: ii (modern paper) + 323 + ii (modern paper). Loose fragments between fols. 36/7, 152/3, 263/4, and 298/9 300 210
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation i-ii, 1–325. Fols. 1–163 with fifteenth-century foliation in arabic (but with c for 100) 1–167 ('c67') in the top left corner of rectos; skipping 50 before modern fol. 50, 55 before modern fol. 54, 60 before (modern) fol. 58, 117 before modern fol. 114.
supportDesc.collation: one quire missing; 1(12–1, 12 canc.?) (fols. 1–11), 2(12)-13(12) (fols. 12–155); 14(12–3: 9–11 canc. before fol. 164) | 15(12)-18(12) (fols. 165–212), 19(14) (fols. 213–226), 20(12)-24(12) (fols. 227–286) | 25(12)-26(12) (fols. 287–310), 27(14–1) (14 canc.; fols. 311–323). Quires numbered 2–27 (the final quire not numbered) on the bottom centre of the opening recto; catchwords.

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 37–40 lines; frame-ruled in ink. Ruled space c. 220–35 145–70
Fols. 254–85 frame-ruled in blind, verticals only.
Fols. 287r-323v: 1 col., c. 32–4 lines, frame-ruled in ink with double bounding lines; ruled space 220–30 145–50

handDesc.handNote: Fols. 1r-163r, 165r-245r, 246v-323r: informal cursive apparently by one hand; fols. 163v, 245v-246r, a second hand; fol. 323v, added by a third hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Art. 1, fols. 1r-163r: little decoration: initial in red with simple decoration, fol. 1r; rubrication unfinished.
Elsewhere red initials with simple penwork decoration in red.

binding.p: Fifteenth-century binding of whittawed skin over boards, sewn on four double/split bands; 4+1 bosses lost on each board; two clasps, fastening on the front board, lost. Rebacked and repaired.

history.provenance: Presumably written at Erfurt, on the evidence of the missing first item.
Erfurt, Benedictine monastery of St Peter: 'Liber Bibliothecae regalis Monasterij S. Petri Erfordiae', 18th (?) century, fol. 1r.

Friedrich Gottlieb Julius von Bülow: probably identifiable as no. 116 in the 1836 sale catalogue ('CONR. SOLTONIS Quaestiones in librum 1. sententiarnm. - JOA, CALDERINI Tract. de .ecclesiastico interdicto'; cf. note on fol. 1r, 'Quaest. M. Conradi Soltonis in 1. Sententiarum').
history.acquisition: Presented to the Bodleian Library by his sons and received in 1857.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford (June 2020, rev. March 2021). Previously described in the Summary Catalogue. Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 22

listBibl.head: Online resources:

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

listBibl.bibl: Balázs József Nemes, Bibliotheca Cartusiae Erfordiensis : Dokumentation über den überlieferten Buchbestand der Erfurter Kartause, 3., korrigierte und erweiterte Version (2022) DOI: 10.6094/UNIFR/223370

msItem.note: Liber sextus with gloss of Johannes Andreae (?) (textus inclusus) and later annotations

msItem.title: Liber sextus decretalium
msItem.note: II.xiv.3, 'ipsius prius facta de illis ... in sua petitione fuerat' (Corpus Iuris Canonici II.1012–13).

msItem.author: Johannes Andreae
msItem.title: Apparatus ad Sextum
msItem.note: Differing slightly from the text as pr. 1582

msItem.title: Canon law
msItem.note: Part of a list of canon law terms; the final entry is for presumptio (iuris, hominis, naturae, facti). The lower half of the leaf is blank.

handDesc.handNote: Cursiva antiquior (anglicana: characteristic two-compartment a, long r and split ascenders).

revisionDesc.change: Finalize description for Polonsky German digitization project.
Draft new description for Polonsky German.
James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
